p: IVs can modulate several oxidative-stress- and redox-activated signaling pathways, such as those involving NF-κB, MAPK, and PI3K/AKT [ 150, 157– 159], to promote viral replication and pathogenesis [ 32, 150, 160– 162]. Therefore, the modulation of these signaling pathways may attenuate IV-induced pulmonary damage.
